definition: to block/to be stuck/to be wedged/customs station/a clip/a fastener/a checkpost/Taiwan pr. [ka3]
to stop/to block/(computing) (coll.) slow/(loanword) card/CL:張|张[zhang1],片[pian4]/truck (from "car")/calorie (abbr. for 卡路里[ka3 lu4 li3])/cassette

sentences.english: China has been toting the "still a developing country" card for far too long.
sentences.chinese: 中国手握‘仍是发展中国家’卡牌已经很长时间了。

sentences.english: Other leisure activities: Several other leisure activities represent serious competition for social board and card games.
sentences.chinese: 一些其它休闲活动也在抢夺桌游和卡牌游戏人口。

sentences.english: Computer and video games: Such games have somewhat displaced social board and card games.
sentences.chinese: 这些游戏代替了社交性的桌面和卡牌游戏。

sentences.english: This is one of biggest reasons why we don't nerf cards very frequently.
sentences.chinese: 这是为什么我们不频繁削弱卡牌的最大原因之一。

sentences.english: Imagine a choose-your-own-adventure style card game.
sentences.chinese: 想象中那是一种随意决定玩法的卡牌游戏。

sentences.english: When you build your deck, make sure you have a good mix of quests and other cards.
sentences.chinese: 当你创建牌组的时候，务必保证卡牌的配合。

sentences.english: Only the cards opened in those booster packs may be used.
sentences.chinese: 只有从这些包里面开出来的卡牌才能使用。

sentences.english: Use a 34-card deck, with a max of 2 of any particular card.
sentences.chinese: 使用一个34张卡的套牌，特殊的卡牌都补到2张。

sentences.english: The importance of patience applies to gluing your cards together, too.
sentences.chinese: 在粘合卡牌时，耐心也是同样的重要。

definition: Magic the gathering (online fantasy game of card collecting and battling)
player (of a game)/enthusiast (audio, model planes etc)
opposing sides (in chess etc)/position (of opposing forces)
to play fast and loose with the law/to game the system/(leisure) rules of the game/way of doing an activity/(tourism) way of experiencing a place
to make an in-app purchase in a game
one who has mastered the sutras (Buddhism)
